snippet: Many feared that President Pierre Nkurunziza’s warning about the Somali militant group was an excuse to criminalize antigovernment protesters.
abstract: Burundi's Pres Pierre Nkurunziza warns against threats from Shabab militants during his first public address since coup attempt to overthrow his government; warning, which Shabab calls unsubstantiated, prompts accusations that Nkururnziza is using fear to maintain power.
lead_paragraph: Many feared that President Pierre Nkurunziza’s warning about the Somali militant group was an excuse to criminalize antigovernment protesters.

headline.main: Burundi President, Surviving Coup, Warns of a Threat From Shabab
headline.print_headline: Surviving Coup, Burundi Leader Warns of Threat From the Shabab

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
